Description: Body sherd of Corinthian pottery krater; interior painted black; exterior: two frizes separated by narrow band with superimposed added red band lined in white; above, goat (legs remaining) to right; at left, trace of unidentified motif; below, confronting panther and goat (of panther, head and shoulder with red remaining; of goat, head, antler, and neck, with red); below, red band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.340)
